messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re:Internet resources for two year olds
messages.msgSnippet: These were written for Montana in the winter, but some would still work: http://sandradodd.com/strew/deblist Some wouldn t be fun or safe for a two year old
messages.messageBody:
These were written for Montana in the winter, but some would still work:
http://sandradodd.com/strew/deblist

Some wouldn't be fun or safe for a two year old but others would work
fine!

Sandra

messages.subject: Re:Internet resources for two year olds
messages.msgSnippet: Universal Preschool has a calendar with different activities for many days of the month (Ex: Nov. 17 is Homemade Bread Day they include the name of a book to
messages.messageBody:
Universal Preschool has a calendar with different activities for many days of the month (Ex: Nov. 17 is Homemade Bread Day they include the name of a book to read, a link to an article on the science of bread making and a link to recipes).
http://www.universalpreschool.com/learning_calendar/

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Internet resources for two year olds
messages.msgSnippet: ... I used to use the internet for craft resources, now, I find it much more fun to go to a craft store and get whatever looks like it might be interesting or
messages.messageBody:
> Hi everyone, I'm looking for Internet resources for things to do with
> my two year old - arts, crafts, ideas for nature etc. Can I get
> spammed with a bunch of resources?


I used to use the internet for craft resources, now, I find it much more
fun to go to a craft store and get whatever looks like it might be
interesting or fun.

A few months back we got a whole bunch of pipe cleaner things of all
sizes (the huge ones are especially fun, even for older kids). We got
them for Marguax specifically, nobody else. She spent weeks playing
with those things, she still has a few piles of unused ones and used
ones that get pulled out and shaped and reshaped. It was about $15
worth of pipe cleaner stuff that's lasted for months and months.

One of the best resources we've used throughout the years is a recipe
book of messy stuff, perfect for a 2 yro. The Ultimate Book of Kid
Concoctions
<http://www.amazon.com/Ultimate-Book-Kid-Concoctions-Wacky/dp/0966108809\
/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1226206580&sr=1-1> It's not an internet
resource, but we've used it for crafty stuff more than any other crafty
book we have! It's not stuff you make and keep, it's tangible, and
edible, or usable and disposable, which I prefer!



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
Hi everyone, I'm looking for Internet resources for things to do with
my two year old - arts, crafts, ideas for nature etc. Can I get
spammed with a bunch of resources?

Anyone in here in South Florida by the way?

Thanks
Laura in Miami
